sn46.30:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sumbhas, near the town of the Sumbhas called Sedaka.
sn46.30:4.2: Then Venerable Udāyī went up to the Buddha …
sn46.30:5.2: How helpful my love and respect for the Buddha have been, and my sense of conscience and prudence.
sn46.30:5.3: For when I was still a layman, I wasn’t helped much by the teaching or the Saṅgha.
sn46.30:5.4: But when I considered my love and respect for the Buddha, and my sense of conscience and prudence, I went forth from the lay life to homelessness.
sn46.30:5.5: The Buddha taught me the Dhamma:
sn46.30:5.6: ‘Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the ending of form.
sn46.30:5.10: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.’
sn46.30:6.1: Then, while staying in an empty hut, I followed the churning of the five grasping aggregates. I truly understood: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
sn46.30:6.2: I comprehended the teaching; I acquired the path.
sn46.30:6.3: When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, it will bring me to such a state that I will understand:
sn46.30:6.4: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
sn46.30:7.1: I acquired the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and equanimity.
sn46.30:7.3: When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, they will bring me to such a state that I will understand:
sn46.30:7.4: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
sn46.30:7.5: This is the path that I acquired. When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, it will bring me to such a state that I will understand:
sn46.30:7.6: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
sn46.30:8.2: For that is indeed the path that you acquired. When developed and cultivated as you’re living in such a way, it will bring you to such a state that you will understand:
sn46.30:8.3: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
